title: Everton's Duncan Ferguson names three toughest opponents | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Now, in an interview with the Times , Ferguson has revealed the three toughest opponents he faced in his top flight career. Sami Hyypia: 'He was so big and so good in the air for Liverpool. He wasn't the quickest, but he read the game brilliantly.' Merseyside derby battles with Sami Hyypia were dates to look forward to for the big Scot Tony Adams: 'A tough, hard, old school defender. There was him, Martin Keown, Gary Pallister and Steve Bruce â€” players who used to get their head in.' Tony Adams approach left its mark on the Everton legend: 'A tough, hard, old school defender' Rio Ferdinand: 'From those I have named, he was the best in terms of being a "footballer". He had a bit of everything. He wasn't a soft touch either.' Perhaps surprisingly Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand is also in Ferguson's top three RELATED ARTICLES
